Here's the link:
 http://www.nbc4i.com/news/3983630/detail.html
 
 I guess this will cook another bowl of grits for the gun haters.
 
 So much hate...... :(

I didn't have much info this morning on the shooting, but I have a little more, now:
 
 http://www.cnn.com/2004/US/12/09/nightclub.shooting/index.html
 
 Seems like the guy just walked in, shot "Dimebag" Darrel Abbott, guitarist for the band "Damagplan", and then begin to fire into the crowd, upset I suppose that Pantera split up. An officer close buy came in and fired, killing the murderer.
Yep, demonically posessed gun forces innocent man to engage in murder.

It really sucks.
 
 Dimebag Darryl was a badass guitarist. A lot of people started to copy his style after "Cowboys from hell." Surely ole Zak Wyllde (or however you spell it) ripped off some of his style and took it mainstream with Ozzy on "No more tears."
 
 It really sucks.
 
 If Phil Anselmo didn't suck so much, I'd be a diehard Pantera fan simply because Darryl's riffs were so heavy. I think it's safe to say the he put the heavy back into heavy metal. 
 
 His death is dark moment in rock.
 
 I'll light one up for ya D!

post_info.post_title: Is that a Crosby Stihls and Nash song?

The anti-gun lobby may be spurred on by this incident, but a recently ended longtime study of gun laws and crime, instigated by people who thought they would find a direct inverse relation between gun restriction and crime rates, ended with the conclusion that local gun restrictions do not affect the local crime rate AT ALL. Criminals will be criminals with or without the legality of firearms possession.
 
 Paul Harvey said that, so it must be true.

The anti-gun lobby may be spurred on by this incident, but a recently ended longtime study of gun laws and crime, instigated by people who thought they would find a direct inverse relation between gun restriction and crime rates, ended with the conclusion that local gun restrictions do not affect the local crime rate AT ALL. Criminals will be criminals with or without the legality of firearms possession.
 
 Paul Harvey said that, so it must be true.

 
 Same old, same old. The anti-gun lobby never rests. They'll latch onto any shooting anywhere to make their point. By the way, welcome back JT.
